name: Kauai Banyan Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Grounds were lovely and Lorna was the best hostess----quietly concerned, not intrusive and immediately attentive to any and every request.
reviews.title: Very nice .....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Pueo Suite and in the cottage and enjoyed the beautiful breezes in both and the different lovely views from each.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Allows you to get out and seek adventure and return to a very peaceful refuge each night.
reviews.title: Best place I've ever stayed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Kauai Banyan Inn is definitely a nice place to stay.
reviews.title: Great place to stay
Great little Inn
reviews.text: Pros: Secluded, Nice and clean rooms. Lorna is a fantastic host and has lived there long enough to advise you on stuff that you can do on the island.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had very nice stay here. This Inn is as described in the listing and was very clean as well as inviting. Be sure to read the guest book and use the recommendations of previous renters to save some time. Lorna was a wealth of local information and provided several places to visit and dine that were very good and reasonably priced. The Koa room was clean, quiet and great to return to every day after our adventures. We slept great! We would recommend this property to anyone.
reviews.title: The Banyon Inn A Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Personally, I find resorts and the people who stay in them a bit exhausting. When I go on vacation I want to have my own private space in which I can really feel at home. Kauai Banyan Inn gave me exactly what I needed.
reviews.title: Skip the beach resorts and check in to this lovely home away from home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While only about 10 minutes from Poipu Beach, this gem feels like it's tucked away in the middle of nowhere. My husband and I rented the cottage, which gave us even more privacy and allowed us to cook breakfasts and dinners in a small kitchen and eat our meals on our own lanai. The room was just the right size, with a nice little kitchen and BBQ outside for grilling up some of the delicious fresh fish you can get at the Koloa fish market.
reviews.title: A convenient and beautiful retreat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lorna, the Inn's keeper, is an amazing woman who really lets guests do as they please, but is around if you need her. She generously offers snorkel gear, beach chairs, beach towels and other goodies to borrow for your beach days, plus she has an amazing dog who lets those with pets who are feeling animal deprived get some furry loving when you need it!
reviews.title: Amazing stay in the new Ali'i suite!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The area gets dead quiet early in the evening, leaving you to get some incredibly restful sleep. There's only one rooster (that I heard) in the area, and he's pretty far off – this is VERY rare on Kauai.
reviews.title: Best in 30 years of Travel
I'm a "picky" person. Everything about KBI is just right.
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in the Ulu suite for five nights. We found it immaculate, spotless, very attractive, quiet and extremely comfortable. The location is really outstanding, at least for the things we wanted to do. Very central, very easy to get to all points on the island (this is a relative statement, but it holds up). Kauai itself is a remarkable place. If you go, do yourself a favor and rent a car, move around, check out the indescribable natural beauty of this (literally) unique place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an inn, not a B&B, so the hostess didn't hover over us, but she was always there when we had a question or comment. Examples: the can opener broke. We left a note, and that evening a nice new one was on the counter. Our jeep got muddy from some trail access. I was worried about excessive rental agency cleaning fees. Lorna handed us a bucket, scrub brush, car wash detergent and a hose.
reviews.title: Stunning Suite that made for a great trip to Kauai

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One tip: though this isn't a B&B, Lorna leaves a generous welcome basket and a few items in the fridge. If you plan to cook/eat in your suite, you may want to check in before shopping. Groceries can be expensive on Kauai, and you don't want to buy things you don't need. Example: we bought a small bottle of Colavita olive oil for $9, but our room already had a bottle of olive oil. Lorna also left coffee and filters. Checking the room first might save you $20 or more.
reviews.title: Country charm, beauty and comfort, very close to town and beaches

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really appreciated Lorna's naturally laid-back-but-responsive manner. We never got the slightest feeling that she was being a solicitous hostess. She was just helpful, in the way a friend of the family would be helpful. No sickening fake overbearing gestures -- she's a warm, friendly, helpful person who follows through on commitments.
reviews.title: Simply an excellent choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check out the pictures others have posted. They are reliable. The bed was more comfortable than our own, and the furnishings are ones you might choose for your own home. The property is away from the road, beautifully landscaped, and quiet. The new suite upstairs, (I think the Ali'i?) is just gorgeous. It's not on the site -- it just opened. But the Ulu Suite, for a bit less money, was also excellent. I didn't see the other rooms so I can't comment on them.
reviews.title: Perfect location, lovely place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved staying here for our week in Kauai. We stayed in the larger room for the majority of our stay. The wraparound windows and balcony , king size bed and extra bit of privacy was well worth the extra cost. The smaller rooms are also lovely but would highly recommend staying the larger rooms. Lorna the innkeeper was so thoughtful. She has thought of everything to make your stay perfect- from snacks to snorkel gear, fresh beach towels - it was so easy to have amazing day trips. We went hard everyday and were so happy to come back here every night. We love this island! By the end of our trip we even loved hearing the roosters at sunrise.
reviews.title: comfortable, peaceful, friendly - gorgeous view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you like peace and quiet and prefer to avoid the ostentaciousness of resorts or lack of privacy and space in a condo then Kauai Banyan Inn is a perfect palce for you. We stayed there 3 nights recently and loved it. Lorna is a gracious host and very accommodating and helpful. We stayed in the Pueo Suite and it was perfect for R&R and fixing our own meals. We found Kauai dining to be less than ideal, its very expensive for what you get. Grilling you own steaks, having bottle of wine or having breakfast on the lanai at Kauai Banyan was ideal. Poipu beach and west side activities are close. Also, no danged roosters in the neighborhood waking us up at 5 a.m. like where we stayed on the north shore. This isa great little place to stay
reviews.title: A Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the cottage for a week, and enjoyed all of the things listed in previous reviews. The cottage is spacious and not lacking in anything you might need. I really appreciated having the room refreshed every other day with clean towels and sheets, since things stay a bit damp from the humidity.
reviews.title: A very comfortable place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cottage is simply furnished and decorated in a palm tree motif. The bed was most comfortable and we slept well (with the earplugs provided). We did wake to the roosters every morning even with earplugs, but they are all over the island and it's part of the charm.
reviews.title: The Cottage Was a Slice of Martha Stewart Living

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay very much. The inn is in a neighborhood on a hillside of nice houses, which made it quiet. The only thing that I didn't expect was that the cottage is set down into a hillside, and looks down over a neighboring house, which was pretty busy on some evenings with people milling around outside. The location of the cottage makes it very private, which was nice, but also doesn't provide the really beautiful views from the rooms that are in the inn's main house. If you are looking for the sweeping views of hillsides and ocean then go for a room in the main house.
reviews.title: What a great experience

description: Perched on a Lawai Hillside surrounded by pasture land and a century old Banyan Tree, is the Kauai Banyan Inn. Only 8 minutes drive to the world famous beaches of Poipu, world class golf courses and a myriad of shops and restaurants, the Kauai Banyan Inn is centrally located yet secluded and private. Cooled by trade wind breezes the seven private self-contained suites each with a private lanai look out onto an extinct volcanic mountain range, the South Shore ocean and the century old banyan tree that graces the entry of this secluded one acre estate.
